intro: Stephanomeria elata, commonly known as the tall globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes mallows and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy, yellow-centered flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs.
